definition: two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)

sentences.english: Occasionally, there are 3,322 young people running pass.
sentences.chinese: 偶尔也有三三两两跑步的年轻人擦肩而过。

sentences.english: The window is bright several only, cup of teas, with your friends at joke world important matter.
sentences.chinese: 窗明几净，一杯茶，三两人在笑谈天下大事。

sentences.english: There are small knots of birds frequently hovering and cherupping over the tree .
sentences.chinese: 三三两两的鸟雀不时在榕树上空盘旋鸣叫。

sentences.english: As the meeting broke up, the participants divided into smaller segments-twos and threes .
sentences.chinese: 散会后，与会者分成三三两两的小组。

sentences.english: She makes a salad and eats it up quickly.
sentences.chinese: 便做了一道沙拉，三两下就把它吃个精光。

sentences.english: I can finish this book in two or three days.
sentences.chinese: 我三两天就可以把这本书看完。

sentences.english: People arrived at the party in-dribs and drabs.
sentences.chinese: 人们三三两两地来到了晚会上。

definition: to gather one's friends/to band together
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
to pour wine/to drink wine/to deliberate/to consider
in groups of three or four (idiom)
to drink together (in company)/to drink together (with food)
